Question.Text: A 32-year-old woman presents to a clinic in Nigeria with fever, headache, jaundice and confusion. She has some fine crepitations at the lung bases. These symptoms developed almost 3 weeks after returning from a visit to rural Nigeria. The patient is of African ethnicity but was born in Europe.

Answer: Severe falciparum malaria with complications - The patient presents with fever, jaundice, altered consciousness, and respiratory symptoms 3 weeks after travel to rural Nigeria. The images show Plasmodium falciparum parasites (ring forms and gametocytes) on blood smear and Anopheles mosquito vector. Delayed presentation with jaundice and confusion indicates severe complicated malaria with possible cerebral and hepatic involvement.
